p: F6 and F9 had the highest and lowest a* and L* values, respectively. Film color is an important attribute that influences consumer acceptance of the food product and has an important role in its marketability. The increase of ΔE in the formulae containing DbE was associated with an increase in b* and slightly more yellowness than F6. However, the increase in the color values of developed films was not sufficient to reduce their apparent acceptability, in accordance with the findings of Atarés, Pérez‐Masiá, and Chiralt ( 2011).
